description: This is a button element on your site. It can be easily customized to fit your site's requirements.

docs.summary: Indicates whether the dashboard button is currently loading.
description: This property can be used to indicate whether the button is currently in loading state. If `true`, the button shows a loading indicator. If `false`, the button does not show a loading indicator.

> **Note:** Use the `showLoader()` function to set the `isLoaderVisible` property to `true` and show the loader. Similarly, Use the `hideLoader()` function to set the `isLoaderVisible` property to `false` and hide the loader.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the button's label.
description: Sets or gets the button's text. Maximum length is 120 characters.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the dashboard button's link.
description: When the dashboard button is clicked, the browser navigates to the `link` location.
The different types of links you can use are:
+ `/localPageURL`: another page on your site
+ `/`: your site's home page
+ `http(s)://<url>`: an external web address
+ `wix:document://<location>`: a document stored in the Media Manager
+ `mailto:<email-address>?subject=<subject>`: an email
+ `tel:<phone number>`: a phone number

docs.summary: Sets or gets the dashboard's button's prefix.
description: You can set a prefix for a dashboard's button label. It can be a string with a value, such as `$`. A prefix can also be a string containing a valid SVG value or an SVG source.
> **Note:** To disable the button's prefix, set the `prefix` property to `null`.

examples.title: Disable the dashboard button's prefix
body: $w("#myElement").prefix = null; // Disable the button's prefix property

docs.summary: Sets or gets the dashboard's button's suffix.
description: A suffix can be a string with any given value, such as `$`. It can also be a string containing a valid SVG value or an SVG source.
> **Note:** To disable the button's prefix, set the `suffix` property to `null`.

examples.title: Disable the dashboard button's suffix
body: $w("#myElement").suffix = null; // Disable the button's suffix property

docs.summary: Sets or gets the target of the dashboard button's link.
description: An element's `target` determines where its [link](#link) opens. The
target can be set so the [link](#link) opens in the current page or
in a new page.
Supported values are:
+ `"_blank"`: The link opens in a new tab or window.
+ `"_self"`: The link opens in the tab or window.
+ `null`: Resets the `target` property to its default value.

examples.title: Resets the dashboard button's `target` property
body: $w("#myElement").target = null; // Resets the target property to its default value of "_blank"

description: The `hideLoader()` function sets the dashboard button's `isLoaderVisible` property to `false`, which disables the button's loading indicator.
The `showLoader()` function sets the dashboard button's `isLoaderVisible` property to `true`, which disables the button's loading indicator.
